Instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Brown the ground beef until fully cooked, about 7 to 10 minutes. Move the cooked ground beef to a plate to drain, while keeping the remaining oil in the pan.

Return the skillet to medium heat with the leftover oil. Add onion, garlic, and curry powder; cook and stir until the onion is nearly tender, about 5 to 7 minutes. Mix the cooked ground beef and cabbage into the onion mixture; then stir in ketchup, chutney, and salt. Add a splash of water to avoid burning, but be careful not to make the curry too wet.
Cook and stir until the cabbage is slightly tender and the flavors are well blended, an additional 7 to 10 minutes.
